faqs.question: How to Install Avatar Toolkit
faqs.answer:
Installing Avatar Toolkit for Blender 4.3 is straightforward:

1. Download the latest version from [link]https://avatartoolkit.xyz/|Avatar Toolkit Releases[/link]
2. In Blender, go to Edit > Preferences
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/install/install1.png[/image]
3. Click on the 'Extensions' tab, then click the dropdown arrow in the top right and select 'Install from File...'
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/install/install2.png[/image]
4. Navigate to the downloaded .zip file and select it
5. If the plugin hasn't automatically been enabled, go to Add-ons, then find the plugin and enable it by checking the checkbox next to 'Avatar Toolkit'
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/install/install3.png[/image]

[note]Avatar Toolkit requires Blender 4.3 or newer. Older versions are not supported.[/note]

[info]After installation, you'll find Avatar Toolkit in the 'N' panel of the 3D Viewport under the 'Avatar Toolkit' tab.[/info]
